citeinfo.title: COAL_NCRDS_2010_IN: Coal Resource Data in Indiana, Derived from the National Coal Resource Data System (Indiana Geological Survey, Point Shapefile)
The Indiana Geological Survey Coal Stratigraphic Database, Indiana Geological Survey Report of Progress 39

descript.abstract: This ESRI ArcGIS (version 10.0) point shapefile is an index to the location of 13,722 public point-source coal resource data points in Indiana. This shapefile includes location and coal resource information for each data point. Detailed location and stratigraphic information for each data point are stored in a separate Microsoft Access database named "NCRDS_Indiana2010.mdb" that is contained in the Indiana Geological Survey Report of Progress 39. COAL_NCRDS_2010_IN shows data points that are included in NCRDS_Indiana2010.mdb.
descript.purpose:
The purpose of this ESRI ArcInfo point shapefile is to provide an index to NCRDS_Indiana2010.mdb: The Indiana Geological Survey National Coal Resources Data System database, a Microsoft Access database of public, point-source coal resource data in Indiana.
Since 1980, staff members of the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) have collected and entered coal resource information into the NCRDS_Indiana2010.mdb database as a cooperative project with the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS). The purpose of this project is to provide a means of rapid retrieval of point-source coal resource information, including coal location, thickness, depth, and other parameters.

idinfo.native: ESRI ArcGIS version 10.0 point shapefile, Microsoft Windows 7.0, file size 34.3 Mb

attracc.attraccr:
Data points were checked to determine whether or not all data points are located within the Pennsylvanian System, as depicted in a 1:500,000-scale ESRI ArcGIS polygon coverage of Indiana bedrock information. Since this database is limited to data points of coal resource information, one should expect all data points to lie within the coal-bearing Pennsylvanian System. This test was performed by displaying this point coverage on the bedrock polygon coverage using ESRI ArcView software. The result of this check revealed that all but a small fraction of the data points were located within the areal extent of the Pennsylvanian System boundary. Those few data points that were outside of the Pennsylvanian System were within one mile of the boundary and are assumed to be valid data.
Spot checks were conducted to compare the values that appear in the fields named "Twnship" and "Range" with townships and ranges in the Public Land Survey System (PLSS) of Indiana. Several discrepancies were noted but not corrected.
Coal beds in Indiana seldom exceed 15 feet in thickness. However, inspection of thickness values indicates that some records exceed reasonable limits for coal thickness.

dataqual.complete: This point shapefile contains 13,722 data points. The coals that are indexed in this point shapefile are limited to coal members of Indiana.

horizpa.horizpar: The accuracy of the location information contained in this ESRI ArcGIS point shapefile is dependent upon the accuracy of the source data of each data point, and the accuracy with which these data were manually entered into the database.

vertacc.vertaccr: The accuracy of the location information contained in this ESRI ArcGIS point shapefile is dependent upon the accuracy of the source data of each data point, and the accuracy with which these data were manually entered into the database.

citeinfo.title: NCRDS_Indiana2010.mdb: The Indiana Geological Survey National Coal Resources Data System database, a Microsoft Access database of public, point-source coal resource data in Indiana, published as Indiana Geological Survey Report of Progress 39

srctime.srccurr: Date of most recent update to the database

srcinfo.srccontr: The source contributed location and attribute information for 13,722 public point-source coal resource data points in Indiana.

procstep.procdesc: A Microsoft Access database named "NCRDS_Indiana2010.mdb" published as Indiana Geological Survey Report of Progress 39 was used to create an ESRI ArcGIS point shapefile. The table named "LOCATION" was loaded in ESRI ArcMap. The 'Add X Y" command was used to display all the points. The "Export" command was then used to export the datapoints as a shapefile named "COAL_NCRDS_2010_IN.shp."

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

distinfo.distliab:
CREDIT
It is requested that the Indiana Geological Survey be cited in any products generated from this data. The following source citation should be included: COAL_NCRDS_2010_IN: Coal Resource Data in Indiana, Derived from the National Coal Resource Data System (Indiana Geological Survey, Point Shapefile), 2000.
WARRANTY
Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey warrants that the media on which this product is stored will be free from defect in materials and workmanship for ninety (90) days from the date of acquisition. If such a defect is found, return the media to Publication Sales, Indiana Geological Survey, 611 North Walnut Grove, Bloomington, Indiana 47405-2208, and it will be replaced free of charge.
LIMITATION OF WARRANTIES AND LIABILITY
Except for the expressed warranty above, the product is provided "AS IS", without any other warranties or conditions, expressed or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties for product quality, or suitability to a particular purpose or use. The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey shares no liability with product users indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages whatsoever, including, but not limited to, loss of revenue or profit, lost or damaged data or other commercial or economic loss. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
